alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 28 at 2:45PM PDT until May 28 at 5:30PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The burn scar in... Central Ferry County in northeastern Washington... * Until 530 PM PDT. * At 245 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Summit Trail burn scar. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the Summit Trail burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the burn scar. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Summit Trail burn scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Summit Trail burn scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Inchelium, Hall Creek, Sitdown Creek, Sleepy Hollow Creek. This includes the following streams and drainages... Carson Creek, Grizzly Creek, Sitdown Creek, Onion Creek, Barnaby Creek, Johns Mountain Creek, North Fork Hall Creek, Hall Creek, Lynx Creek and Sleepy Hollow Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
